item.title: Lizette add a quote by George MacDonald
item.description: "No story ever really ends, and I think I know why. " -- George MacDonald

item.title: Lizette add a quote by George MacDonald
item.description: "Our life is no dream; but it ought to become one, and perhaps will." -- George MacDonald

item.title: Lizette add a quote by George MacDonald
item.description: "If we will but let our God and Father work His will with us, there can be no limit to His enlargement of our existence" -- George MacDonald

item.title: Lizette add a quote by S.E. Hinton
item.description: "Stay gold, Ponyboy, stay gold." -- S.E. Hinton

item.title: Lizette add a quote by S.E. Hinton
item.description: "Can you see the sunset real good on the West side? You can see it on the East side too." -- S.E. Hinton

item.title: Lizette add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Man is the only creature who refuses to be what he is." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Lizette add a quote by Kate Chopin
item.description: "The city atmosphere certainly has improved her. Some way she doesn't seem like the same woman." -- Kate Chopin

item.title: Lizette add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "There are books of which the backs and covers are by far the best parts." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Lizette add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "It is a far, far better thing that I do, than I have ever done; it is a far, far better rest that I go to than I have ever known." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Lizette add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "No one is useless in this world who lightens the burdens of another." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Lizette add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "It was the best of times, it was the worst of times." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Lizette add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "There is a wisdom of the head, and... there is a wisdom of the heart." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Lizette add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "Every traveler has a home of his own, and he learns to appreciate it the more from his wandering." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Lizette add a quote by Lois Lowry
item.description: "Take pride in your pain; you are stronger than those who have none" -- Lois Lowry

item.title: Lizette add a quote by Lois Lowry
item.description: "There is something about that moment, when literature becomes accessible, and a door of the world opens. " -- Lois Lowry

item.title: Lizette add a quote by Lois Lowry
item.description:
"The man that I named the Giver passed along to the boy knowledge, history, memories, color, pain, laughter, love, and truth. Every time you place a book in the hands of a child, you do the same thing. It is very risky. But each time a child opens a book, he pushes open the gate that separates him from Elsewhere. It gives him choices. It gives him freedom. Those are magnificent, wonderfully unsafe things.
[from her Newberry Award acceptance speech]" -- Lois Lowry

item.title: Lizette add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "The opposite of love is not hate, it's indifference. The opposite of art is not ugliness, it's indifference. The opposite of faith is not heresy, it's indifference. And the opposite of life is not death, it's indifference." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Lizette add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "There may be times when we are powerless to prevent injustice, but there must never be a time when we fail to protest." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Lizette add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "When a person doesn’t have gratitude, something is missing in his or her humanity. A person can almost be defined by his or her attitude toward gratitude." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Lizette add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "We must always take sides. Neutrality helps the oppressor, never the victim. Silence encourages the tormentor, never the tormented." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Lizette add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "One person of integrity can make a difference." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Lizette add a quote by Eugene O'Neill
item.description: "Man is born broken. He lives by mending. The grace of God is glue." -- Eugene O'Neill

item.title: Lizette add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "Hope is the thing with feathers That perches in the soul And sings the tune without the words And never stops at all." -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Lizette add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "That it will never come again is what makes life so sweet." -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Lizette add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "If I read a book and it makes my whole body so cold no fire can warm me, I know that is poetry. If I feel physically as if the top of my head were taken off, I know that is poetry. These are the only ways I know it. Is there any other way?" -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Lizette add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "I dwell in possibility…" -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Lizette add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "To live is so startling it leaves little time for anything else." -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Lizette add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description:
"I'm nobody! Who are you? Are you nobody, too? Then there ’s a pair of us—don’t tell! They ’d banish us, you know.
How dreary to be somebody! How public, like a frog To tell your name the livelong day To an admiring bog!" -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Lizette add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "There is no Frigate like a Book To take us Lands away, Nor any Coursers like a Page Of prancing Poetry – This Traverse may the poorest take Without oppress of Toll – How frugal is the Chariot That bears a Human soul." -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Lizette add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "Pardon My Sanity In A World Insane" -- Emily Dickinson
